body: Support for the Org Hooks API Preview #539
Fixes a bug when creating an Issue without labels #538 @djreimer

- Deployments API is now final #537
- Fix bug with negative `resets_in` values for rate limiting #536 @markphelps 
- `Client#update_issue` now acts like a `PATCH` #531 @djreimer 
- Bumps Sawyer to support `Sawyer::Resource#each` lostisland/sawyer#33
- Various docs typo fixes

Supports [auto pagination][] in `Octokit::Client#pull_requests_comments` - #526 @gylaz 

[auto pagination]: https://github.com/octokit/octokit.rb#auto-pagination
Compatibility updates for v0.8.0 of netrc gem - #522
- Removes preview warnings for Team Membership API methods - #518 // @afeld

- #505 Remove preview warning for Combined Status API // @theckman 
- #507 Implement [Org invitation API][blog] // @blt04 

[blog]: https://developer.github.com/changes/2014-08-05-team-memberships-api/
Fixes a bug where not sending the appropriate `Content-Type` request header would result in a `500` error from the API.
Support for new Team Memberships API

name: v3.2.0
body:
- Methods that take a repository `:owner/:repo` argument now accept an `:id` - #485 @joeyw 
- Methods that take a User or Org name argument now accept an `:id` - #485 @joeyw 
- Documentation type fixes - #488 #490 @abonas
- Fix tests for console masking - #493 @frank-west-iii
- Test improvements - #492
- Deprecate SSH key, Deploy key update methods - #491

name: v3.1.2
body: No changes since v3.1.1. Bumping to fix a RubyGems issue.

name: v3.1.1
body:
- `Octokit::Client#user_keys` no longer requires authentication #474 
- RSS parser is only loaded as needed #484 
- Numerous documentation fixes

name: v3.1.0
body:
- Numerous documentation edits - @catsby @salbertson
- Updates for [newly paginated methods][paginate] - @jdpace #469 
- New `.as_app` method to use OAuth app creds over Basic Auth for some methods #467 
- Support for [token management methods for OAuth apps][token-mgmt] #467 

[paginate]: https://developer.github.com/changes/2014-03-18-paginating-method-changes/
[token-mgmt]: https://developer.github.com/v3/oauth_authorizations/#check-an-authorization

name: v3.0.0
body:
- Tweaks to support changes in the [Deployments API Preview][deployments]. #443 - @atmos
- Support for the [Combined Status API preview][combined] #456 - @bhuga 
- Remove Ruby warnings #434 - @sferik 
- `OCTOKIT_SILENT=true` to hush preview API warnings #447 @joeyw  
- Various test fixture improvements @joeyw 

[deployments]: http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/deployments/
[combined]: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/statuses/#get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-ref

name: v3.0.0 preview
body:
- Support for the [Deployments API Preview][deployments].

[deployments]: http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/deployments/

* Myriad of docs fixes @StephenOTT @joeyw @barisbalic
* Test setup tweaks @joeyw @sigmavirus24
* More API coverage @joeyw @md5 #373
* Date fields for Commit listings are now `DateTime` objects- lostisland/sawyer#16

- #350 Use relative paths for search requests for Enterprise - @benburkert
- #353 Fix method redefinition warnings - @zenspider
- #360 Properly paginate `.users`, `.following`, `.followers` - @arthurn
- #351 #352 #354 #356 #357 Numerous docs updates
#349 - Fixes an issue with .netrc support when the .netrc file doesn't include a line for the client's `.api_endpoint`. - @catsby
Redacts OAuth client secret and access tokens in error messages - #342 @catsby

* #336 Adds new `.available_hooks` method to `Client` - @danmcclain
* #338 Fixes a bug where app creds were not passed to API root - @rmetzler
* #335 Fixes a bug where pull requests weren't paginated - @pedro
Remove `warn` for Releases and Search APIs
Adds `Octokit::Conflict` for `409` errors. - @bhuga

Adds support for [`GET /user/teams`][teams].

[teams]: http://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/teams/#list-user-teams

* Restores 1.8.7 compatibility #317 boxen/boxen#111
* Removes spec files from gemspec to fix installation on Windows #313

* Adds support for the new [Releases API][api]
* Adds `.errors` array to `Octokit::Error`

[api]: http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/releases/

Updates to support [GitHub 2FA][2fa].

- New error type `Octokit::OneTimePasswordRequired` raised when response is `401` but `X-GitHub-OTP` present
- New [idempotent token creation][PUT].

[2fa]: http://developer.github.com/changes/2013-09-03-two-factor-authentication/
[PUT]: http://developer.github.com/v3/oauth/#get-or-create-an-authorization-for-a-specific-app

This new major version is [hypermedia-enabled][hypermedia], version 3.0.0 will aim to be hypermedia-driven. See the [Upgrade Guide][upgrading] for more.

#### Highlights


* Totally refactored `Configuration` and defaults to support memoized `Client` objects, required to use middleware like [faraday-http-cache][] for [conditional requests][].
* Bumped Faraday dependency to 0.9
* New `Client#last_response` for raw access to the last HTTP response, including pagination headers.
* Moves `search_*` methods to `legacy_search_*`
* Uses [VCR][] for more robust test request/response fixtures.
* Uses [Sawyer][] under the hood for hypermedia support. HTTP responses are now proper Resources with link Releations. `Client.root` and `Client#agent` are also provided to make hypermedia requests:

```ruby
>> Octokit.root.rels[:user].get :uri => {:user => 'mojombo'}

```
* Support for the new [Search APIs][blog] as a preview feature.

```
>> Octokit.search_code 'octokit in:file extension:gemspec'
WARNING: The preview version of the Search API is not yet suitable for production use.
See the blog post for details: http://git.io/_-FA3g

#<Sawyer::Resource:0x007faf749ec138 @_agent=<Sawyer::Agent https://api.github.com/>, 
...
```
[blog]: http://git.io/_-FA3g
* Adds ability to check if one user follows another via `.follows?` - @catsby 
* Adds to new error classes for `403` responses:
  - `Octokit::TooManyRequests` when rate limit exceeded
  - `Octokit::TooManyLoginAttempts` when special login attempt limit exceeded


[faraday-http-cache]: https://github.com/plataformatec/faraday-http-cache
[conditional requests]: http://developer.github.com/v3/#conditional-requests
[Sawyer]: https://github.com/lostisland/sawyer
[VCR]: https://github.com/vcr/vcr
[hypermedia]: https://github.com/octokit/octokit.rb#hypermedia-agent
[upgrading]: https://github.com/octokit/octokit.rb#upgrading-guide

name: 2.0 Release Candidate 3
body:
- Adds ability to check if one user follows another via `.follows?` - @catsby 
- Adds to new error classes for `403` responses:
  - `Octokit::TooManyRequests` when rate limit exceeded
  - `Octokit::TooManyLoginAttempts` when special login attempt limit exceeded

name: 2.0 Release Candidate 2
body:
This release candidate adds support for the new [Search APIs][blog] as a preview feature.

```
>> Octokit.search_code 'octokit in:file extension:gemspec'
WARNING: The preview version of the Search API is not yet suitable for production use.
See the blog post for details: http://git.io/_-FA3g

#<Sawyer::Resource:0x007faf749ec138 @_agent=<Sawyer::Agent https://api.github.com/>, 
...
```
[blog]: http://git.io/_-FA3g

name: 2.0.0 Preview
body:
This is the first pre release of 2.0.0 and includes a number of changes. While this version is hypermedia-enabled, version 3.0.0 will aim to be hypermedia-driven.

* Totally refactored `Configuration` and defaults to support memoized `Client` objects, required to use middleware like [faraday-http-cache][] for [conditional requests][].
* Bumped Faraday dependency to 0.9
* New `Client#last_response` for raw access to the last HTTP response, including pagination headers.
* Moves `search_*` methods to `legacy_search_*`
* Uses [VCR][] for more robust test request/response fixtures.
* Uses [Sawyer][] under the hood for hypermedia support. HTTP responses are now proper Resources with link Releations. `Client.root` and `Client#agent` are also provided to make hypermedia requests:

```ruby
>> Octokit.root.rels[:user].get :uri => {:user => 'mojombo'}

```





[faraday-http-cache]: https://github.com/plataformatec/faraday-http-cache
[conditional requests]: http://developer.github.com/v3/#conditional-requests
[Sawyer]: https://github.com/lostisland/sawyer
[VCR]: https://github.com/vcr/vcr
